fields.description:
I've noticed that BITBUCKET_BRANCH is not set when manually running a custom build (which probably makes sense really).

It would be nice if we had a variable we could use to check why a build was run ("manual", "scheduled", "commit", "REST", etc).
fields.summary: FEAT REQUEST: BITBUCKET_TRIGGER or similar variable in Pipelines

fields.description:
This repository is currently unavailable.

Please resolve.
fields.summary: Each of my repository is showing error message

fields.description: For debugging error we have lost access to a repository, I would like to know if there is any way to reset the permissions, I have an administrator level account.
fields.summary: lost access to repository

fields.description:
Hi!

I'm currently evaluating replacing our companies Jenkins jobs with Atlassian Pipelines

I have been able to build my Scala code and the resulting Docker image simply enough, but once the Docker image is built I would like to push it to Amazons ECR.

Is this currently possible?

Justin
fields.summary: Push an image to AWS ECR after it builds

fields.description:
With multiple tabs open, it's difficult to tell which is which.

!1005884236-BB_PR_tabs.png|thumbnail!

The tabs would be much more useful if the order of elements was reversed.

So instead of

{{project > repo > Pull Request #n TITLE — Bitbucket}}

it was something like

{{#n TITLE — project > repo > Pull Request — Bitbucket}}
fields.summary: Optimize PR (Pull Request) tab title for differentiation

fields.description:
Currently if you copy code from the overview page of a pull request you pick up "+"s and "-"s on the left side of the code.  Copying code from the side by side diff page doesn't have that problem.

One option would be to move the + and - characters to the left side of the vertical line that separates line numbers from code.
fields.summary: Allow a user to cleanly copy code from a Pull Request

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to receive email notification related to PR comment

###Steps to Reproduce

# Watch the repository and Pull-request
# Add a comment in the PR using different account
# Edit the comment
# Delete the comment

###Expected Results

* Received email notification in regards to the action

###Actual Results

* Didn't receive any notification related to the PR comment

###Notes

* Start seeing the issue on 29th Sept
* Users able to receive notification when\\
** commit is added to PR\\
** Approve PR\\
** Merge PR
fields.summary: Unable to receive email notification related to PR comment (BBCDEV-8040)

fields.description:
Pull Request's new/updated comments doesn't trigger webhooks.

h3. Observation
* Webhook works fine for _pullrequest:unapproved, pullrequest:rejected, pullrequest:created, pullrequest:approved, pullrequest:updated, pullrequest:fulfilled, pullrequest:comment_deleted_ actions.
* Only _pullrequest:comment_updated, pullrequest:comment_created_ is affected.

Sample:\\
!2168872762-PR%20webhooks.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: PR's new/updated comments doesn't trigger webhooks

fields.description:
The create Pull Request button on Internet Explorer 11 is greyed out not allowing to create a pull request. The version used on IE 11 is - "11.1593.14393.0"

!3870876864-1.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create Pull Request button greyed out on IE 11.

fields.description: Well, pretty much as the title says. It would be extremely helpful to be able to retry a single step in a long pipeline...
fields.summary: Rerun step in pipeline

fields.description: When adding pages to wiki if I add page of the format "abc/xyz" and then from xyz If I try adding another page the content tab doesn't appear properly. Attached is a screenshot.
fields.summary: Wiki Content tab doesn't appear properly.

fields.description:
I was removing my branches using xargs in two processes (-P2) and I got the following error when I tried to remove some branch:

{code}
remote: Traceback (most recent call last):
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 185, in _get_response
remote:     response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/newrelic/hooks/framework_django.py", line 527, in wrapper
remote:     return wrapped(*args, **kwargs)
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/views/decorators/csrf.py", line 58, in wrapped_view
remote:     return view_func(*args, **kwargs)
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/apps/httphooks/views.py", line 39, in inner
remote:     content = func(request, environ=environ)
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/apps/httphooks/views.py", line 56, in postgithook
remote:     return posthooks.githooks(request, environ)
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/orochi/git.py", line 1859, in wrapper
remote:     push = GitPush.fromfile(repo, input_ or sys.stdin)
remote:   File "/opt/python/domains/bitbucket.org/current/bitbucket/local/env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/orochi/git.py", line 1953, in fromfile
remote:     for ref in repo._repo.listall_reference_objects():
remote: OSError: failed to read descriptor: Stale file handle
{code}
fields.summary: Error while branch batch removal

fields.description:
Between each subsequent page load within the dashboard, the left hand menu disappears and is then re-rendered. The dashboard menu disappears like this:

!388626569-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-29%20at%2018.07.53.png|thumbnail!

A second later (which feels like ten years in UX time) the menu finally comes back. Congratulations, you've got the same menu back you already had, even if you click the very same page you're already on.

!1526507745-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-29%20at%2018.09.55.png|thumbnail!

The inefficiency is infuriating and the user experience is awful. If you're clicking to a section within the same menu, the menu doesn't need to be touched.
fields.summary: Rerendering dashboard menu between every single page

fields.description: As far as I can tell, once I've created an issue, I can at most close it, but not delete it. I should be able to, as the issue creater. (!)
fields.summary: No way to delete an issue you created by mistake

fields.description:
Don't you think it would be preferable to have wiki for project (in terms of bitbucket), not for repository.

For example my project has three repositories (for any reason), but documentation has to cover all three repositories.
fields.summary: Wiki for project, not for repository

fields.description: Sometimes developers forget to add the proper message to use the Smart Commit, would be nice if the Smart commit also works by adding a comment at the commit.!2061977661-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-28%20at%2017.20.50.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Smart commit "triggered" by comments on

fields.description: By adding Assignee dropdown to the workflow step above the comment will provide huge benfit because the user will not need a separate 'Edit' to change the assignee.
fields.summary: Provide for changing assignee during workflow

fields.description:
Once my pipeline fails I cannot see the logs for this.

Please fix this soon.
fields.summary: Pipelines not showing logs

fields.description: Since PR authors are not allowed to be added as reviewers, then do not suggest them in the 'Recent' area for suggested reviewers
fields.summary: Don't show PR Author in 'Recent' for suggested reviewers

fields.description: The current max build time is 2 hours. I have had a test hang during build due to a database connection never dropping during the test. It would be great to be able to set a max build time (e.g. 20 minutes instead of the default 2 hours) to not chew up build time so much when this happens.
fields.summary: Add max build time option

fields.description: When creating a PR, there is a handy list of recent reviewers that you can pick from. I use this a lot with my team. Sometimes PRs can pile up on a particular dev, it would be nice if I could see how many open PRs each of my recent reviewers had so that (if applicable) I could select people who are the least inundated with PRs.
fields.summary: Show count of open PRs for recent reviewers

fields.description:
Add the ability for users to easier remove access from All repos and account.\\
right now this is a laborious process where the Admin needs to go though all repos and groups to make sure the user is removed and it's very time consuming.\\
Would more user friendly if we added an option "remove All access "  or something similar
fields.summary: Have a better way of removing users from account and direct repos access

fields.description:
The ability to add a pre-receive hook to bitbucket cloud repositories would be immensely useful.

We would like to reject pushes which don't conform to repository guidelines.

Currently the only way to achieve this is opt-in using client-side hooks, which is clunky and error-prone.
fields.summary: pre-receive webhook

fields.description: While the experience of writing Comments on bitbucket pull requests is richer since the last UI update was pushed to bitbucket sites (around september 2017), the speed of the whole UI, especially adding comments has become much less. I routinely have to wait 5 seconds after CLICKING inside the comment box before I can start typing.  This is highly irritating.
fields.summary: Commenting on PR has become much slower since introduction of the new rich comment editor.

fields.description: Dashboard is not showing content correctly when you navigate to "https://bitbucket.org//" (double final slash), "https://bitbucket.org/" works well.
fields.summary: Wrong page when navigating to https://bitbucket.org//

fields.description:
For example, when I change versions of jQuery, the diff is thousands of lines long, and it interferes with the reviewer's ability to see the important changes.

A simple toggle at the top of every file would do the trick.
fields.summary: Give option to toggle files closed in diff

fields.description: To me, it's frustrating that I can get 15 emails when somebody is reviewing my code. I would rather get a single email when a person has finished their review. Something like a "begin review" button would be great, which would let you make multiple comments before submitting.
fields.summary: Submit comments on PR/commits all at once, instead of one at a time

fields.description:
If I check my source code on site, the file contents are displayed as UTF8.\\
However if I hit raw, the encoding is something different.\\
e.g. the word "Csokoládé" ends up being "CsokolÃ¡dÃ©".

Src view:\\
https://bitbucket.org/balinabbb/snwich-backend/src/3ba8853f52eba5285d7aa26d16df64cc8ba3aa25/snwich-admin/snwich/static/snwich/scripts/dessert.js?at=master&fileviewer=file-view-default

Raw view:\\
https://bitbucket.org/balinabbb/snwich-backend/raw/3ba8853f52eba5285d7aa26d16df64cc8ba3aa25/snwich-admin/snwich/static/snwich/scripts/dessert.js
fields.summary: Raw file encoding

fields.description:
Hi, get some trouble with understanding of your "attachments" resource in api docs for api v2.\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/issues/%7Bissue_id%7D/attachments#post

You dont specify name of the parameter for uploading file, and i can't attach file to issue via REST API.\\
Always getting 400 error !1247045716-1506494910428.jpg|thumbnail!

Can you help me? Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Inaccurate description of the "post attachment" method in apidoc.

fields.description:
This user has requested we keep their identity a mystery. Let's never speak of this again.

What should I do？
fields.summary: My account can't log in

fields.description:
Currently we do not have an API Call for a webhook to check for the status / response of a webhook request.

It would be a useful feature to be able to check the status / response of a webhook request.
fields.summary: API to check for Webhook Request Status / Response

fields.description:
Currently the error message provided does not give the exact message of where the problem lies.

It would be nice if we could handle the error to inform of where the issue lies or which field.

!913508553-Schermafbeelding%202017-09-25%20om%2009.55.41.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Importer error shows "DataError: value too long for type character varying(255)"

fields.description:
When viewing a pipeline build in Microsoft Edge browser, the pipelines build does not fill up the whole page. The height of the build is shown on half of the page.

*Workaround* - Resize browser (in any way) => content will resize to full height

!2474171062-pipelines%20bug.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pipelines build does not fill the whole page in Microsoft Edge browser

fields.description:
When there is a pull request with a big amount of files and changes, it is not easy to go back to the list of files.\\
A good enhancement would have a button to go "back to list" of files.
fields.summary: Improve navigation of large pull request diffs

fields.description:
Docker has an opportunity to set an environment variable with a dot:\\
*-e "bootstrap.memory_lock=true"*\\
or docker-compose:

{code}
#!yaml

    environment:
      - cluster.name=docker-cluster
      - bootstrap.memory_lock=true

{code}

And it's requirements for some projects (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docker.html)

But *bitbucket-pipelines.yml* provides only one way for environment variables  - as dict. So and we can't use dots in names as in the example above.
fields.summary: There is no way to set an environment variable with a dot

fields.description:
I can't push anymore, Even after I run "git gc".

The last time I pushed a file it was a script ( 250 lines small file ).\\
And now I'm trying to push an other script and this error happens:

repository is in read only mode (over 2 GB size limit)

How can I solve it?
fields.summary: repository is in read only mode (over 2 GB size limit)

fields.description:
h1. Problem
After Jira Cloud is integrated with repositories on Bitbucket, some read only webhooks are created like these.

* URL: https://dss-webhook-receiver.prod.public.atl-paas.net/api/external/1.0/bitbucket/webhooks?jiraUrl=https://jiracloud.atlassian.net
* URL: https://jiracloud.atlassian.net/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/webhook

But these links cannot be removed after Atlassian Cloud is deactivated.

This is very similar with [13607|BCLOUD-13607].
fields.summary: Read only links in webhooks panel are not removed when Atlassian Cloud is disabled

fields.description: [Pull request iterative reviews|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/bitbucket/new-features-bitbucket-4-11] was added to Bitbucket Server 4.11 and would be extremely useful to have in Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: Iterative reviews

fields.description:
There used to be a very useful feature that me and my team used to check all the time which now seems to have been removed (in the last 24 hours).

When I create a feature branch I go to that repository and click {{Branches}} from the left menu, then I used to see all the feature branches create for that repository and I was able to see how many commits that branch is behind or ahead of master. This was a very useful indicator and I don't understand why it's removed, nor I can find any settings to re-activate it.

!2315950144-CommitsIndicator.png|thumbnail!

Is there a way to bring this back again please?
fields.summary: Can't see commits indicator for a feature branch anymore
Diff - Add indication of new lines at end of file

fields.description:
The build status of pull requests are no longer shown in the pull requests section of my personal (projected independent) dashboard. When navigating into a specific PR or showing the list of PRs for a specific project everything is shown an fine.

Happens in Chrome as well as in Safari (macOS + Windows10)
fields.summary: Pullrequests in Dashboard not showing Build Status

fields.description:
I have tried today for login bitbucket on safari browser and I got stuck at Dashboard which is attached.

For GoogleChrome is working fine.

Actual Behavior : It's should show correct screen any part of website.\\
Expected Behavior : It's should work with safari browser.

OS : 10.12.6\\
Safari Version : 11.0 (12604.1.38.1.7)

I have attached 3 photos

* 2 photos from Safari browser
* A photo from GoogleChrome browser
fields.summary: Menu on Bitbucket is not loading with Safari on OSX

fields.description:
Hi, I'm trying to build a pipeline which has dependency from an artifact generated by another pipeline under the same project. It always fail because there's no way it can see the artifacts from another pipeline during maven build.

Is there a way to store it that can be visible across repositories that are under the same project?
fields.summary: Sharing maven cache between repositories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing a team's _Settings_, there is a dropdown available that allows you to switch among teams you administer and your individual Bitbucket account: !1742109994-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-25%20at%2014.14.34.png|thumbnail!

This dropdown is not available in the rest of the team's pages, _Overview_, _Projects_, _Snippets_, _Members_. If users want to navigate to another team or their individual Bitbucket account, they'll need to do so via the menu from their avatar.

h3. Suggested Solution
Some users would like to have this dropdown available in all pages of a team/individual account, so they can quickly switch team/account views.
fields.summary: As a user I want to easily switch among teams I have access to via a dropdown

fields.description:
About a week ago one of our python pipelines stopped working\\
No changes were made to the bitbucket-pipelines.yml for months\\
We tried debugging it locally according to your\\
[guide|http://bit.ly/2yBHpRp]

but couldn't recreate the behavior seen in the pipeline\\
even when using 2gb ram

it fails on the pylint command without any error

attached a log file
fields.summary: Pipeline fails on pylint

fields.description:
When I click on the webhooks link on my bitbucket cloud, it shows a blank page.\\
What's going wrong in new bitbucket? It was ok in some days ago.
fields.summary: Repository webhooks page doesn't exists?

fields.description:
When I click on the webhooks link on my bitbucket cloud, it shows a blank page.\\
What's going wrong in new bitbucket? It was ok in some days ago.
fields.summary: Repository webhooks page doesn't exists?

fields.description: my webhook option lefthand menu on my bitbucket repository settings shows a blank page when clicked
fields.summary: Webhooks page is empty

fields.description:
When the last command hangs and outputs no logs, the duration shown is misleading.\\
This is due to the duration only being calculated up until the last log was generated.
fields.summary: Command duration is incorrect for hung commands

fields.description:
Hi, wondering if I can make a suggestion for a small enhancement to the "Open Tasks" functionality of pull requests

Currently if you have open tasks it will show them next to a 'ticked box' icon which is confusing as to whether the tasks have been completed or not.

Can you change this icon to just a unticked checkbox?
fields.summary: Pull Request - Open Tasks Icon

fields.description:
When i enter to my bitbucket space i always see a warning message about my email is unconfirmed. What can i do ?

Greetings!
fields.summary: I can not confirm my email

fields.description:
Hi

Using Ubuntu and mercurial 4.3, I am faced with\\
a bizarre problem, running hg clone for a bitbucket account I receive

warning: connecting to media-api.atlassian.io using legacy security\\
technology (TLS 1.0); see https://mercurial-scm.org/wiki/SecureConnections\\
for more info\\
error fetching bundle: [Errno 1] _ssl.c:510: error:14090086:SSL\\
routines:SSL3_GET_SERVER_CERTIFICATE:certificate verify failed\\
abort: error applying bundle\\
(if this error persists, consider contacting the server operator or disable\\
clone bundles via "--config ui.clonebundles=false")

so I set in the global .hgrc file\\
[ui]\\
clonebundles = false

and I could clone, but the error seems very odd.\\
Any idea?

thanks

Uwe Brauer
fields.summary: problems with clonebundle and bitbucket

fields.description:
When I try to clone any repository, the download speed is VERY slow, < 100 KiB/s (yes, kilobyte per second!). When I connect from an abroad instance EC2 from Amazon AWS, the download speed is normal.

I have these problem on every connection from Brazil: from my work network, home or even from my 4G connection.

When I try to download from Github, the download speed it's 100% > 2 MiB/s.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Why so slow when I try to clone a repository from Brazil?

fields.description: See screenshot attached.
fields.summary: The clone URL input doesn't have to be fixed length

fields.description: My Bitbucket Webhook option against a project shows are blank page
fields.summary: WebHook Bug

fields.description:
When creating new issue breadcrumb for issue in user/repo/issue is missing, if you don't know what breadcrumb is, in fact you don't even show the title of issue that you're looking at, which explains how issues don't show up unless you go level deeper/branch (basically topic).

It is the first result for autocomplete, and I'd like to be able to navigate to issues from there.
fields.summary: New issue is missing breadcrumb

fields.description: We have validations set up for PR merges.  However, although we don't see any errors on this specific PR and looks like all validations were satisfied, it didn't enable the merge button.  Pressing the merge button displayed a message stating there were conflicts but the File Changes didn't show any.  Stuck at this point.
fields.summary: No errors shown for merge conflict

fields.description:
So I followed [the docs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/javascript-node-js-with-bitbucket-pipelines-873891287.html#Javascript%28Node.js%29withBitbucketPipelines-Downloadandpublishmodulestoaprivateregistry] for adding the {{.npmrc}} file so the script can auto publish to the NPM registry.

When I add the {{NPM_TOKEN}} to the repository, this works fine.\\
But when I add it to my personal {{Bitbucket settings > Pipelines > Environment variables}} (and delete it from the repository), I get an error

{code:bash}

+ npm install
Error: Failed to replace env in config: ${NPM_TOKEN}
    at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/config/core.js:418:13
    at RegExp.[Symbol.replace] (native)
    at RegExp.[Symbol.replace] (native)
    at String.replace (native)
    at envReplace (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/config/core.js:414:12)
    at parseField (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/config/core.js:392:7)
    at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/config/core.js:335:17
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at Conf.add (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/config/core.js:334:23)
    at ConfigChain.addString (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/config-chain/index.js:244:8)
/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/npm.js:39
      throw new Error('npm.load() required')
      ^
Error: npm.load() required
    at Object.get (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/npm.js:39:13)
    at exit (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/utils/error-handler.js:60:40)
    at process.errorHandler (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/utils/error-handler.js:180:3)
    at emitOne (events.js:96:13)
    at process.emit (events.js:188:7)
    at processEmit (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/npmlog/node_modules/gauge/node_modules/signal-exit/index.js:146:32)
    at processEmit [as emit] (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/npm-registry-client/node_modules/npmlog/node_modules/gauge/node_modules/signal-exit/index.js:146:32)
    at process._fatalException (bootstrap_node.js:296:26)
{code}

Maybe this has something to do with the fact that I couldn't see the {{Pipelines > Environment variables}} in my {{Bitbucket settings}} until I created a test-repo with a pipeline and clicked on the {{View account variables}} link?\\
!1345028308-Schermafbeelding%202017-09-21%20om%2013.33.30.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Account level variable isn't resolved

fields.description:
On a failing test you get an email (sensible) but you don't get an email on a successful test (sensible). The problem is that after a failing test if someone pushes a fix then you don't get notified.

Essentially I would like a 'success' email added, but only if the previous test was a failure. At the moment you have to manually log in to check if someone pushed a working test after the failing one to know that it's been fixed.
fields.summary: Email on success after build failure

fields.description: Using toolchains to test and build against JDK 6. Would be great if Pipelines could be configured to support toolchains.
fields.summary: Maven Toolchains support in pipelines

fields.description:
The omnibar feature did not suggest any kind of snippets.\\
Would be great if we this feature also give suggests from the snippets of the user.
fields.summary: Omnibar did not suggest Snippets

fields.description: We have 600 pages of build result and would LOVE to be able to search into the titles of those pipeline results.
fields.summary: Add a search button in the pipeline panel

fields.description:
We have a problem with downloading LFS-files. Log:

Downloading Assets/Game/WorldMap/Visuals3D/Events/ExpEvent_Drill.fbx (345 KB)\\
Error downloading object: Assets/Game/WorldMap/Visuals3D/Events/ExpEvent_Drill.fbx (fa2e5c1): Smudge error: Error downloading Assets/Game/WorldMap/Visuals3D/Events/ExpEvent_Drill.fbx (fa2e5c19c3770104d3c48c82a0af24a0339a511fb7defe1f0900ee4904d5e0d9): LFS: Get https://media-api.atlassian.io/file/a0457a59-867c-4c68-9580-6aa2649ad497/binary: read tcp 192.168.1.34:65160->138.68.82.26:443: i/o timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Received Timeout error while adding file larger than 1GB on the Download page.
fields.summary: Unable to upload >1GB file through Download Page

fields.description:
Bitbucket Server allows users to specify if they want Pull request email notifications send to them immediately or batched: !976582033-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-21%20at%2015.52.01%201.png|thumbnail!

Some users would like to have the same setting in Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: Batched notifications for pull requests

fields.description:
When I do Code Review mostly on large Pull Requests (containing many files), and I have to stop it for some time and come back later to resume the Code Review, sometimes I do not remember which files I already reviewed.\\
This adds extra time on my Code Review process, since I would have to review some files again.\\
I would like to have a feature on the Pull Request page where I could flag which files I already reviewed.\\
Also, on the list of files on the top, I would like see an icon indicating if I already reviewed that file or not.
fields.summary: Flag which files I already reviewed on a Pull Request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, subscribing to a Pull request in Bibtucket Cloud, will send to the user notifications for all Pull request events, e.g. when a reviewer is added, when a comment is added. This often results in a large number of emails for users, and sometimes users don't want to receive notifications for all those events.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to select what Pull request events they want to subscribe to, for example:

* A reviewer is added
* A comment is added
* A comment is edited
* A comment is replied to
* A commit is made to the source branch
* A pull request is opened
* The pull request is approved
* The pull request is merged
* The pull request is declined
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to subscribe/unsubscribe to specific Pull Request events

fields.description:
The Dashboard "Overview" page shows builds status icons just fine for the pull requests, but the "Dashboard -> Pull requests" page no longer shows the build status. Instead, it shows the 'watch' icon where the build status should be.

!2370827722-dashboard.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Builds status no longer visible in "Dashboard -> Pull requests"

fields.description:
Hi,

I have 3 repositories : A, B, C.\\
A has Pipelines enabled.\\
B has in its access keys the Pipelines public key of A, works well since August.\\
Builds of A run good.

Now, A needs C.\\
I want to add the same Pipelines public key of A in C access keys but I encounter this error : *Key is not long enough. Bitbucket requires RSA keys be at least 2048 bits.*

I did not see a mention in changelog or update notice on your side.

Have I to setup a new Pipelines public key of A and deploy it again in B and C ?\\
Or is it a bug on your side ?

Thanks
fields.summary: Pipelines SSH key too short

fields.description: Sometimes web browsers keep current scroll position when you refresh the page so that you get positionned where you were after page reload. It's not working on pull request page, I guess this is related to dymamic content loading. If possible that could be nice to restore vertical scroll position after reloading page (or moving browser history).
fields.summary: Scrolling position lost after refreshing PR

fields.description:
Using a SSH Key is created in Pipelines (Repository Settings >> Pipelines >> SSH Keys),  and adding it to a repository in User Account Level ("Bitbucket Settings >> SSH Keys") or Repository Level (Repository Settings >> Access Keys)", it shows an error as below

Error : *Key is not long enough. Bitbucket requires RSA keys be at least 2048 bits*

The reason for this is because Bitbucket requires at least RSA Key size to be at 2048 bits. However the key size generated in Pipelines (Repository Settings >> Pipelines >> SSH Keys) is 1024 bits.

*Workaround* - As a workaround, please proceed to generate the SSH Keys on your local machine with at least 2048 bits according to the suggestion in the error message.
fields.summary: SSH Key created in repository settings for pipelines shows error when adding in Bitbucket Account due to key size

fields.description:
It's been a couple months since I used bitbucket and I see things have radically changed.  Now I can no longer submit pull requests, probably because there is no description field showing up next to the "Description" header?

I'm running Safari (which is a supported browser, last I checked) on a Mac.
fields.summary: Cannot enter description in (or submit) pull requests

fields.description:
The old site was able to update branches from the forked repo (using compare, which really should be added back). The new GUI is not able to. Now, the only way to update a branch from the main repo is to do it manually on command line. This seems a major loss of functionality.

If I do a PR from the main repo, I am not able to select my fork to update the branch. If I do a PR from my repo, I can only select my repo branches and not the main repo I forked. So for non GIT gurus who use don't know command line, they have to delete their repo and refork just to update their branches. This makes team projects a disaster and defeats the purpose of using Git with this site.

This has my team at a stand still now since we are forced to use this broken new design. We are all working on a new branch that is added to the main repo that we all forked. The only way to even get this new branch is to delete our forks and re-fork... Even after this, we are not able to update our local branches with the master repo branch without deleting our forks.

How do you expect users to update local branches from the forked repo? If a PR cannot do it how else can we? This is a severe issue and is preventing development
fields.summary: Cannot update local branches from forked repo (major loss of functionality)

fields.description:
I cant login to bigbucket.org on my new laptop.\\
I am using chrome, but have also tried Edge and get same error.\\
Any suggestions?

I found some old posts with this error, but they all say fixed. Its only just started happening for me.

Interestingly, a few days ago I got some request asking me to merge my atlassian account with my bitbucket account, which I did.  This could be what has broken my login.

I belive that both my bitbucket and my atlassian account had the same email, so I have no idea which one I am trying to login with. I have tried all combinations of email, username and passwords.
fields.summary: CSRF verification failed. Request aborted

fields.description:
BCLOUD-4588

Marcus there is a pattern that is happening over and over. People want another state in the workflow that indicates the code needs to be tested: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5179/add-a-status-of-closed-to-issues\\
I think most people just need one more state in the workflow. I mean really the "invalid" and "wontfix" state are superfluous. If you could kill one of those and replace it with "testing" or something I would and I'm sure many others would be happy. No need for custom workflows or complicated the notification just replace or add a state in the workflow.
fields.summary: Customisable workflow

fields.description:
In Bitbucket if I write a comment and type "@shane" without stopping to choose the user from the auto-complete window and I click the Comment button it converts and sends the mention to "Shane Preece" even though "Shane Preece" is not in my organization or authorized to access my repository.  If I typed company-confidential information in the comment then now this other user has it that should not have that information.

Instead I should get an error when I am on my corporate private repository so I know to go change it to "@sisaacs" who is "Shane Isaacs" that DOES have access to our repository.

JIRA handles this properly and just leaves "@shane" as literal text without sending a notification instead of resolving it to a user outside of our organization.
fields.summary: Mentioning a user incorrectly in a private repository can send confidential data to external users

fields.description:
Good afternoon,

I have a problem when deploying my application, I have other applications that can perform deploy without errors but this in specific I can not do. I saw that an early problem occurred on the server but it is already normalized. Dai wanted to know the reason, if it's something with the repository
fields.summary: Unable To Connect To Code Provider

fields.description: This is a request to have an option similar to Smart commits but that would work based on the results of a Pipeline builds. The JIRA issue would be updated accordingly with the results a Pipeline build
fields.summary: Pipelines builds to update JIRA issue

fields.description:
Currently the pipeline file must be named "bitbucket-pipelines.yml".\\
It should be "bitbucket-pipelines.yaml", following official YAML specs.

I understand that there is a BC question, so likely you should support both extensions
fields.summary: bitbucket-pipeline wrong extension

fields.description:
When a repository is transferred to another account successfully, on the new account there will be a notification mentioning that there is a transfer pending.

In Repository Settings >> Repository Details >> Transfer or Delete Repository, we can only see the option to Revoke the transfer.

Even though the transfer was completed, it still shows as transfer is pending.
fields.summary: Transfer pending notification does not get cleared even if transfer is completed.

fields.description:
It would be nice when viewing pull requests to see a git-blame context somewhere in the diff/inline. This has come up as a feature our team thinks would be useful in the case where you may have 2 developers working on a feature in a branch that will be reviewed by each other or a 3rd party. For us this happens often, especially as a small team.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Blame context for pull requests

fields.description: In Overview for a team repo, when I click on the box that says "3 watchers" [view watchers of this repository], nothing happens.
fields.summary: repo has watchers but nothing happens when I click to see them

fields.description:
Hi,

When I push my changes to my bitbucket repository, I get this error:

bq. hg push --new-branch\\
pushing to https://GFX47@bitbucket.org/GFX47/gladiabots\\
http authorization required for https://bitbucket.org/GFX47/gladiabots\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: GFX47\\
password:\\
searching for changes\\
abandoná: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error


I have 30 outgoing changes, I thought maybe it was caused by the amount of data to push so I tried to only push one revision (-r XXXX) but I get the same error.

Thanks for your help.\\
Sébastien
fields.summary: Getting "HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error" on hg push

fields.description:
Over the last few weeks we have seen the frequency of clones over ssh being dropped or the speeds starting out ok, but going down to well under 100KBps.

Example remote hung up:\\
Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.\\
fatal: early EOF\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

Example slow:\\
$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:tnw/openhip.git\\
Cloning into 'openhip'...\\
remote: Counting objects: 23579, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (9765/9765), done.\\
Receiving objects:  93% (21956/23579), 56.22 MiB | 67.00 KiB/s

Don't think this one is really resolved:\\
https://status.bitbucket.org/incidents/8y7zwqwffmwj
fields.summary: git clones dropped by remote or speeds going to <100KBps

fields.description:
Pipelines build usage minutes on the repo level under pipelines "Usage" doesn't match account usage minutes under Settings -> Plan Details

If you are not the Admin on account and only have access to the Repo and would like to check on the repo level how many minutes are remaining for your account under "Usage"  this screen doesn't reflect correctly the "Free minutes used this period"\\
However if you go to the account Settings -> Plan Details -> build minutes used this billing period -> the number of minutes used that is appearing in Grey is reflecting correctly the number of minutes remaining.

Would be great if we can bring those 2 screens into sync\\
Please see screen shots attached for visual explanation
fields.summary: Pipelines build usage minutes on the repo level doesn't match account usage minutes

fields.description: When trying to add a group of users to a repo, if your plan does not support that many users, it shows a nice little error. The link is not being formatted correctly though :)
fields.summary: Link not encoded

fields.description:
I'm trying to change the e-mail for notifications on bitbucket but the "Email aliases" section shows a different e-mail that is associated with my atlassian account, and therefore I can't change it.\\
At bitbucket, it shows the e-mail "jamirotheripper@gmail.com" associated with atlassian:\\
!1424635376-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-19%20at%2016.21.03.png|thumbnail!

When I click "manage your Atlassian account" the e-mail shown at atlassian is different (bruno.ferreira@codacy.com):\\
!3833500199-Screen%20Shot%202017-09-19%20at%2016.30.06.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Problem with integration between bitbucket and atlassian account

fields.description:
Firefox 55.0.3

The Tags/Branch  labels are sometimes missing in Commits view. The labels sometimes appears after couple of refresh.\\
Please see the attached image.

https://bitbucket.org/[Company]/[repo]/commits/branch/master\\
or\\
https://bitbucket.org/[Company]/[repo]/commits/branch/all
fields.summary: Tags/Branches label missing in web interface

fields.description: We are very interested in adopting the entire atlassian tool suite but our source repository is very large (+200GB).  With out GVFS we would be unable to move to a git based scm.   Please add GVFS support to bitbucket.
fields.summary: Please add support for GVFS

fields.description:
Source branch selector does not work when viewing a public repository and not signed in.\\
On the overview page, the HTTPS to SSH clone URL switch does not work as well.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Open incognito mode or log out of Bitbucket
# View a public repository
# Go to Source and select a different branch

The issue does not occur if the user is signed into a Bitbucket account.
fields.summary: Source branch selector does not work when viewing a public repository and not signed in

fields.description: The feature doesn't work properly on Google Chrome at Mac. First, it was not letting me sign-in into Trello, and then I signed in using Safari to bring my boards. Now when Trello is integrated, and I have set the board using Safari, I still can't see my cards etc while using Chrome.
fields.summary: Trello doesn't work properly using Google Chrome on Mac

fields.description: Webhooks limit 100 rows and no have pagination or load new rows when bottom.  I can't view or edit data rows more than 100.
fields.summary: Webhooks limit 100 rows.

fields.description:
I am receiving the following message for my repository\\
"This repository is currently unavailable."\\
/bowenmediany/chocolateworks

Can you remove this repository? Thanks
fields.summary: Unable to delete the repository

fields.description:
If I create two repos named as e.g. "repo" and "repo.git" they will redirect to the same URL.

* https://bitbucket.org/username/repo.git/

Dropping repo "repo.git" in the limbo, since it does not create an URL as below.

* https://bitbucket.org/username/repo.git.git/
fields.summary: Repos named as .git at the end are messing up with the URLs.

fields.description:
The duration of downloading the cache (before the build) and of uploading it (after the build) should be listed as a separate step in the log, just like "Build setup" or my script commands.

This is useful for Maven repositories, which take around 2 minutes to upload for my builds. As the Maven build itself also prints its duration, it could be confusing for users to see that some Pipelines builds take several minutes longer than the "actual" build.

Also, one cannot currently see that a build resulted in populating the cache after it finished - you have to watch the build status while it's still running to see this. Listing these steps in the log would obviously improve this.
fields.summary: List cache download/upload in Pipelines log

fields.description:
* hg clone --noupdate https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/tripcloud/tripcloud . && hg update -C "de2567dad4570175b9e1fa92dc05affb418fa42a"\\
applying clone bundle from https://media-api.atlassian.io/file/6e538681-630b-4ee1-a5f4-1a57d318db62/binary?token=XXX\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 64562 changesets with 153775 changes to 31504 files (+78 heads)\\
finished applying clone bundle\\
searching for changes\\
abort: HTTP Error 400: Bad Request
fields.summary: App pipelines are failing with 400 Bad Request

fields.description:
This 3 features are mandatory to have pull request work well. We can't prevent someone not rebase to merge

Bitbucket is a great tool but some old request core features start to be really missing.

For examples this top voted request included in server version and in GitHub are mandatory to claim to be a good tools nowadays.

BCLOUD-6106

BCLOUD-13895

BCLOUD-11571

Sry to duplicate but this use cases could be resolve by implementing top voted, 4 years old request!!
fields.summary: Prevent someone not rebase to merge a pull request

fields.description: hi, i just installed latest version of github and i have successfully logged into github but when i try to pull or fetch the code it asks for bitbucket credentials again and again even i type the right credentials i use on bitbucket,Please solve this problem.
fields.summary: Unable to authorize with bitbucket

fields.description: Pipelines and Trello may be all cool and all for some groups but having them auto add to teams is a nuisance. We use bitbucket for its ease of integration with our Atlassian suite, but auto adding integrations and having developers be bombarded with these new "features" causes issues.
fields.summary: Dont auto add Integrations

fields.description:
By default, merge commits are de-emphasized in the repository's "Commits" page by greying them out. They're still present and accessible, but they're not obvious.\\
This is problematic to me. Merge commits are my _most_ important commits and, if anything, should be highlighted. In my workflow, major features enter master exclusively through merges.\\
I understand from this [forum thread|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Why-are-merges-grayed-out/qaq-p/377251] that it's an intended feature, but I wanted to add my voice to those requesting that this be optional. Maybe it already is, and I just couldn't find the setting?
fields.summary: Optionalize Merge Commit Grey-Out
